item.description:
In honor of Black History Month, Boston By Foot will be offering a special tour of African American history in Boston. This walking tour will focus on the history of slavery, segregation, and racism in Boston from the arrival of the first African American slaves.

Though Boston was initially conflicted over the issue of slavery given the need for cotton by the New England textile industry, abolitionist leaders such as William Lloyd Garrison, Lewis Hayden, and Charles Sumner emerged in Boston.

This special tour explores Boston's role in the abolitionist and civil rights movements and how 5-year old Sarah Robert's effort to attend school initiated the outlawing of segregation in Massachusetts public schools.

This tour of African American History meets at the Park Street Church on the corner of Park and Tremont Streets. Tickets are $15 per person ($5 for Boston By Foot members).
item.how_to_find_us: Look for your guides with Boston By Foot bags and buttons.
item.name: African American History Tour
